file_content.text: Streets are already starting to feel safer.
I've dealt with your friends in CorSec.
They weren't my friends. They were reckless, put innocent lives in danger. Had to be put down.
Doesn't mean I'm doing cartwheels, though. They were Corellians, former comrades. Still... thank you.
Please, try to keep the fighting off the streets if you can. Don't want any civilians getting caught in the cross fire.
This fighting's got to stop! There's good folk dying out there, all because those CorSec boneheads don't know when to quit.
Used to wear the uniform myself once, back when it still meant something.
Now CorSec's just a bunch of trigger-happy hooligans with more ammo than common sense. Always looking for a fight.
At least you had the good sense to submit to the Empire.
You were wise to give in.
Those other so-called "officers" would've done the same if they actually cared about the public's safety.
The sooner they accept Imperial control, the sooner we can put this bloodshed behind us.
They should surrender.
That's what I told 'em. But they only care about winning. Don't give a hoot about protecting the citizens.
Some people just refuse to admit when they're beat. Hard to bring those types in alive.
Sound pretty stubborn.
Afraid that may be true here, too.
If you have any information on these insurgents, I suggest you share it.
You know their operation.
I don't like ratting anyone out, but they've crossed the line, endangering the populace like they have.
Didn't expect to see a CorSec officer supporting the Empire.
Strange loyalties you have.
Former officer. I joined CorSec to uphold the law. The Empire's the law here now.
You hope I'll handle them.
Someone needs to bring a little peace and order to this city.
These streets would be a lot safer without those hotheads blasting everything in sight.
Listen, ah... my lord? If you wanted to give some of those CorSec boys a stomping, I might be able to help out.
If you're looking to give some of those CorSec boys a good kicking, I can point you in the right direction.
I'll handle it.
I can't say "no" to a fight.
As long as I get my credits.
I've got some funds available. They're yours if you can get this done quiet-like.
Shouldn't be hard to draw them out. Just swipe a comm array off a CorSec probe droid and activate its distress signal.
Won't be long before they come a-running. These things tend to escalate fast, so try to activate that signal someplace secluded.
Not now. [Refuse quest]
Hope you change your mind. These people have seen enough violence.
Corellia's in Imperial hands now. Best everyone just accept it and move on.
